intro: Bryonia sagittata, commonly known as the arrowleaf bryony, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces orange-red berries that contain toxic compounds, making it potentially harmful to humans and animals. Native to southern Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in dry, rocky soils. Due to its toxicity, it is often considered a weed in agricultural settings.
